name: reintroduction
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] the act of putting something into use after it has not been used for some time; the act of putting something in a place where it has not been for some time: They are opposed to the re-introduction of the unpopular tax. Wildlife experts supervised the reintroduction of wolves to the national park. He did not hide his view that wolf reintroductions threaten basic human freedoms.
[ S ] the act of experiencing something again after you have not experienced it for some time: The conference was supposed to be my reintroduction to the world of politics. He looked nervous on his reintroduction to high-level competition. Related words
introduction
reintroduce
More examplesFewer examplesThey have plans for the reintroduction of wild boar and elk to the region.Ten pregnant females were released in the park as part of a reintroduction programme.She is campaigning for a reintroduction of traditional values.
